page.title: 02BOSTON WEST HISTORY.
page.content: The school was opened in{September {1976.On Saturday 19th March 1977, Boston West School was extensively damaged by{fire.}It started in class 4. The following day a boy was caught , and admitted he did it.The damage was tremendous although it did not spread to the{infant department,}but it left a sticky black gunge all over. No one was in the building at this time but people in the neighbourhood soon noticed the blaze.Special arrangements had to be made.The {infants went to Carlton Road Nursery Unit and the{juniors went to Staniland Juniors,on{Fydell Crescent.}The infant end was cleared and the infants came back. The juniors came back later in {mobile classrooms}until the juniors was restored.The school was{re-opened {on December 3rd 1977.
